snippet: The Ukrainian government proposed a law granting “special status” to the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, but it was unclear whether that would be acceptable to Russia.
abstract: Ukrainian government submits draft law to Parliament that will grant 'special status' to the breakaway Donetsk and Luhansk regions for three years, in keeping with provision of cease-fire agreement with separatists; it is not clear that bill, if it passes, will be acceptable to separatists or their patron in Moscow, Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and CARLOTTA GALL
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from Kiev, and Carlotta Gall from Donetsk, Ukraine.

lead_paragraph: The Ukrainian government proposed a law granting “special status” to the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, but it was unclear whether that would be acceptable to Russia.

headline.main: Kiev Offers ‘Special Status’ for Breakaway Regions
headline.print_headline: Kiev Offers ‘Special Status’ for Breakaway Regions

keywords.value: Organization for Security and Cooperation in Europe
keywords.name: organizations
